basics.summary: Backend-focused Full Stack developer building reliable, scalable systems with a strong foundation in architecture and system design.

highlights: Built a **high-concurrency** appointment dispatch system for VUC using Redis atomic locks and optimized SQL transactions, achieving **sub-50ms latency** and **eliminating race conditions** under load.
Designed a scalable **data ingestion architecture (500GB+)** using Airflow, Iceberg, and Trino for optimized OLAP querying over **compressed parquet files**.

Engineered a plug-and-play Identity Provider using Bun & ElysiaJS with **passwordless WebAuthn**, stateless RS256 JWT + JWKS verification, Redis-backed challenge management, and **real-time geo-aware session revocation**.

Delivered a **production-ready content management platform** end-to-end under tight timelines, architecting a secure Admin Dashboard that streamlined the publishing workflow and enabled management of **10,000+ content pieces** at launch.

Built an automated GenAI pipeline for **real-time vernacular translation** and structured metadata extraction, **reducing manual editorial effort by 90%** and significantly accelerating global content rollout.
Built a **scalable, multi-tenant ticketing system** with RBAC and automated assignment using Node.js, Express, MongoDB, Redis, BullMQ, serving **200â€“250 users across 5+ teams**.
Engineered a **real-time notification and messaging pipeline** using Redis Pub/Sub, Socket.io, PostgreSQL, handling **10k+ concurrent requests/min** with horizontal scalability.

projects.name: System Design Articles
projects.description: Articles talking about system design of [real-time video conferencing apps](https://medium.com/@ariyanwaliya/video-calling-platform-system-design-zoom-c94a48cca205) like Zoom, [rate limiters](https://medium.com/@ariyanwaliya/from-fairness-to-security-building-a-rate-limiter-a3623c4828de), [flash sale problem](https://medium.com/@ariyanwaliya/50-iphones-100k-users-and-one-very-angry-database-designing-flash-sales-5a5c3a1cd8b0), [designing modern dashboards](https://medium.com/@ariyanwaliya/intent-queries-and-subscriptions-a-better-mental-model-for-analytics-uis-30b1380cd932) and much more ..

projects.name: Database Deep Dive Series
projects.description: Wrote articles talking about database discussions like [OLTP vs OLAP](https://medium.com/@ariyanwaliya/oltp-vs-olap-breaking-down-transactional-vs-analytical-systems-5a6850ddeacd), [B Trees vs LSM trees](https://medium.com/@ariyanwaliya/from-reads-to-writes-understanding-b-trees-vs-lsm-trees-8eb494415152), [CockroachDB](https://medium.com/@ariyanwaliya/inside-cockroachdb-the-engineering-behind-serializable-transactions-8d2946e2de2c), [TarantoolDB](https://medium.com/@ariyanwaliya/somewhere-between-redis-and-postgres-tarantooldb-adcc1dc6bdd4), [MVCC](https://medium.com/@ariyanwaliya/inside-postgresql-mvcc-internals-page-bloat-autovacuum-and-vacuum-full-mechanics-b63a81dcb4c9), and much more.

projects.name: Finetuning Llama
projects.description: Fine-tuned the LLaMA 2 7B pretrained model using parameter-efficient techniques such as LoRA and QLoRA on an SQL dataset, following meticulous preprocessing to align the data with LLaMA's input requirements.

projects.name: Data Engineering and AI Articles
projects.description: Articles that explore production grade data engineering and AI pipelines built for scale, wrote articles on [ANN algoritms at scale](https://medium.com/@ariyanwaliya/scaling-vector-search-a-practical-comparison-of-ann-techniques-972a9becb2fc), [Trino](https://medium.com/@ariyanwaliya/lessons-from-the-trenches-scaling-analytics-with-trino-17b70e1e3197) to query files on blob, [building distributed graphs at scale](https://medium.com/@ariyanwaliya/why-netflix-didnt-use-a-graph-database-building-a-real-time-distributed-graph-from-first-df194c564b3d), and much more.
